intro: Dorstenia erecta, commonly known as the erect false cucumber, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally twisted stems and waxy, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often resembling a cucumber in appearance. Dorstenia erecta is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded, humid environments. It is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
